intro: Erysimum crassistylum subsp. crassistylum, commonly known as the broadleaf wallflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and hairy. Its flowers are bright yellow, often with a dark central stripe, and bloom from late winter to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
